iristk.util

Class Record

  • java.lang.Object
    • iristk.util.Record
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BodyPart, CameraViewItem, Context, Event, Item, Location, Phone, ProsodyProfile, RecHyp, Rotation, Shape, Space, TestRecognizer.Settings, Transcription, Word

    public class Record
extends java.lang.Object
    A Record is essentially a map of key-value pairs (much like any java Map). However, it supports a convenient way of adding and accessing values deep in the hierarchy by using colon (:) notation.

    For example you can add a value like this: myRecord.put("foo:bar", 5). If the key "foo" does not already contain a nested Record, it will create one. It will then put the value 5 under the key "bar".

    You can also access values like this myRecord.get("foo:bar"). If it is not possible to traverse "foo" and then "bar" in the nested hierarchy, the method will return null.

    There are also convenience functions for getting a value of the right type. For example, myRecord.getInt("foo:bar") will try to convert the value to an Integer. If this fails the method will return null.

    Using kleen stars (*), it is also possible to search the hierarchy using the has() method. Thus, myRecord.has("*:bar") will return true.

        public java.lang.Integer incrInteger(java.lang.String field,
                                     int incr)
        Increments the Integer under @field by @incr and returns the incremented value. If there is not such @field, it is set to @incr.

      • incrInteger

        public java.lang.Integer incrInteger(java.lang.String field)
        Increments the Integer under field by 1 and returns the incremented value. If there is not such @field, it is set to 1.
